Articles.Content:
I also want to make some aircraft cannons such as a Gsh-30.

Gsh-6-30, Gsh-30-2, Gsh-6-23, Yak-B. You have no options here

Gsh-6-30, Gsh-30-2, Gsh-6-23, Yak-B. You have no options here

but i like options

Can you re add the small R-60 heat seeking?

it was amazingly useful for small aircraft

Just a quick question: Has anyone done any sort of torpedo yet? I was just thinking about it and thought that it'd be an excellent weapon for use against crafts made with the "Maritime Pack". Just an idea...

Just a quick question: Has anyone done any sort of torpedo yet? I was just thinking about it and thought that it'd be an excellent weapon for use against crafts made with the "Maritime Pack". Just an idea...

From what I've gathered, unless someone gets REALLY creative, there is no way they're happening

Yeah torpedos are not viable unless you could selectively disable water collision. And as for the R-60 the R-73 is essentially a newer version of the same missile and performs better than the old R-60 did
But its too big for my mini fighters
Please enjoy R-10

thank you

- - - Updated - - -

Edit: the AIM-26,GBU-57a,MIM-14 and BLU-82 model and texture are invisible
... ill take a look at that when classes are over

found another issue, the radar of the AN-AWW-13 is pointing to the pylon instead of pointing to the front

Edited September 10, 2015 by EdusacconBR

found another issue, the radar of the AN-AWW-13 is pointing to the pylon instead of pointing to the front

*Sigh* I'll try rotating it after class 10.1 should be good around 5:30-6:00
Sweet! RIM-162 is one of my favorite SAMs out there
Ok i fixed the problem and removed the defunct AGM-84
Yes!! a addon to the mod that turns the game into DCS

the new textures and remade models are amazing, i also really like the folding wings on some of the missiles

i also found a few bugs

the KH-38 appears to be GPS guided, not infrared and the KH-29 and RIM-174 are both unusually large in the part menu thingy

the new textures and remade models are amazing, i also really like the folding wings on some of the missiles

i also found a few bugs

the KH-38 appears to be GPS guided, not infrared and the KH-29 and RIM-174 are both unusually large in the part menu thingy

I switched the KH-38 to GPS since it wasn't working well as infrared and I cant determine the cause of thd visual but but it still works fine

Hi LORDPrometheus,

I started my own addition based on your missile tutorial today!

(of course i had to have some more info but i got most of it)

view it here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/134038-WIP-1-0-4-Q-Armory-BDA-addon-0-00?p=2190561#post2190561

Hi LORDPrometheus,

I started my own addition based on your missile tutorial today!

(of course i had to have some more info but i got most of it)

view it here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/134038-WIP-1-0-4-Q-Armory-BDA-addon-0-00?p=2190561#post2190561

glad to see i could help out if you run into any snags feel free to PM me

Hey LORDPrometheus, great tutorial! I'm just encountering a small problem...

I have a missile I'm making that has fins that fold forward, like such:

Now I've gotten the top/bottom and left/right fins to work well but the two 45, and -45 fins aren't cooperating so much. I was wondering if there is a way I can get them to fold down into their slots nicely. Thanks in advance!

Hey LORDPrometheus, great tutorial! I'm just encountering a small problem...

I have a missile I'm making that has fins that fold forward, like such:

http://i.imgur.com/SS8TO1h.png

Now I've gotten the top/bottom and left/right fins to work well but the two 45, and -45 fins aren't cooperating so much. I was wondering if there is a way I can get them to fold down into their slots nicely. Thanks in advance!

reset their relative orientation in the 1st keyframe and rotate along both the x and z axis and it should be more even
Alright, thanks a lot!
Is there any chance you might add the SM-2MR, aka the RIM-66 Standard Missile?

Quick question for you Prometheus. When making those textures for the model, after I put them in gimp and move my color layer behind the texture, the color doesnt bleed through! Maybe the occlusion has no transparency? Any ideas?

Quick question for you Prometheus. When making those textures for the model, after I put them in gimp and move my color layer behind the texture, the color doesnt bleed through! Maybe the occlusion has no transparency? Any ideas?

No you just forgot to set the ao layer to multiply instead of normal
